headline.main: THE JAPANESE EMBASSY.; Arrival of the Roanoke at Hampton Roads. Programme of the Reception at Washington. A Great Military and Civic Display Anticipated.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Roanoke having reached Hampton Roads last evening, the Philadelphia steamed up to her this morning, and anchored at a distance of about eighty paces. The water was as smooth as a mirror, and the air balmy. The sun-light glistened on the bright uniforms which filled the deck. Every window porthole, or opening of any kind in the Roanoke, was ...

headline.main: THE GREAT PRIZE FIGHT.; ERRORS OF THE ENGLISH PRESS CORRECTED. A Review of the Late Combat Additional Traits of the Scene Prize-fighting less Revolting than the Vulgar Idea.

docs.lead_paragraph: I have a last word to say about the great Prizefight between HEENAN and the English Champion. The excitement which exists in England, and the discussion which has already commenced, warrant me in adding my mite of evidence to the facts in the case. I saw every thing that transpired, from beginning to end.

headline.main: The Real Population of New-York Diminishing.
